StringLiteralExpr.value: In a few seconds a pop-up screen will prompt you to choose from one\nof 4 methods, in order to generate random variables from the Negative Binomial Distribution.
Choose a method for generating n random variables from the Neg.Binomial :
1) Inverse transform Method
2) Convolution Method (using Bernoulli D.)
3) Convolution Method (using Geometrical D.)
4) Acceptance Rejection Method
You have selected the Inverse Transform method. Please wait...
Please give me the size of the sample :
Type the value of the parameter of successes R :
Now give the probability of success P :
Please standby...
Your sample has been saved in data1.txt
The time needed, depending on your machine'' speed \n and the complexity of the algorithm, was:
Empirical & Theoritical pdf of the Neg. Binomial Distribution

You have selected the Convolution method 
(using as a prime several Bernoulli variables). 

Please wait...
Please give me the size of the sample :
Type the value of the parameter of successes R :
Now give the probability of the bernoulli trials P :
Please standby...
Your sample has been saved in data2.txt
The time needed, depending on your machine'' speed \n and the complexity of the algorithm, was:
Empirical & Theoritical pdf of the Neg. Binomial Distribution

You have selected the Convolution method 
(using as a prime several Geometrical variables). 

Please wait...
Please give me the size of the sample :
Type the value of the parameter of successes R :
Now give the probability of the bernoulli trials P :
Please standby...
Your sample has been saved in data3.txt
The time needed, depending on your machine'' speed \n and the complexity of the algorithm, was:
Empirical & Theoritical pdf of the Neg. Binomial Distribution
You have selected the Acceptance-Rejection method). \n\nPlease wait...
Please give me the size of the sample :
Type the value of the parameter of successes R :
Now give the probability of the bernoulli trials P :
Please standby...
Your sample has been saved in data4.txt
The time needed, depending on your machine'' speed \n and the complexity of the algorithm, was:
Empirical & Theoritical pdf of the Neg. Binomial Distribution

You have selected to test between the three first methods.
For the 4th one the envelope function selected was rather unsuitable since it was
the discrete uniform.
With an other function as an envelope it would be very hard to test
through a wide range of (R,P)
since the Neg. Binomial''s shape would change.

Please wait. It will take some time ...
Please give me the size of the sample. It would be most preferable to choose sample bigger than 10000! :
Please go drink a coffee...\n

One would choose the method which uses the sum of the geometrical variables
since the Anova table also recommends this method!
Have a nice day.
Have a nice Day!!!
